Key.description: User-defined criteria for sending commands that target managed nodes that meet the criteria.

Values.description:
User-defined criteria that maps to `Key` . For example, if you specified `tag:ServerRole` , you could specify `value:WebServer` to run a command on instances that include EC2 tags of `ServerRole,WebServer` .

Depending on the type of target, the maximum number of values for a key might be lower than the global maximum of 50.

Targets.description:
The `Targets` property type specifies adding a target to a maintenance window target in AWS Systems Manager .

`Targets` is a property of the [AWS::SSM::MaintenanceWindowTarget](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-resource-ssm-maintenancewindowtarget.html) resource.

description: The `AWS::SSM::MaintenanceWindowTarget` resource registers a target with a maintenance window for AWS Systems Manager . For more information, see [RegisterTargetWithMaintenanceWindow](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/APIReference/API_RegisterTargetWithMaintenanceWindow.html) in the *AWS Systems Manager API Reference* .

Name.description: The name for the maintenance window target.

OwnerInformation.description: A user-provided value that will be included in any Amazon CloudWatch Events events that are raised while running tasks for these targets in this maintenance window.

ResourceType.description: The type of target that is being registered with the maintenance window.

Targets.description:
The targets to register with the maintenance window. In other words, the instances to run commands on when the maintenance window runs.

You must specify targets by using the `WindowTargetIds` parameter.

WindowId.description: The ID of the maintenance window to register the target with.
